text:
María Esther Gorostiza Rodríguez (28 October 1931 – 18 May 2019), better known as Analía Gadé, was an Argentine actress. She appeared in more than 60 movies between 1948 and 2001. She starred in movies such as "Emergency Ward" (1952), "Yesterday Was Spring" (1955), "Crime on a Summer Morning" (1965), "Another's Wife" (1967) and "The King is the Best Mayor" (1974). She was born in Córdoba. Her brother was playwright Carlos Gorostiza.
Gadé died on 18 May 2019 of cancer in Madrid. She was 87.

annotations.surface_form: The King is the Best Mayor
